title: Towards circular plastics within planetary boundaries - Nature.com
summary: The study assesses the planetary footprints of GHG mitigation strategies for global plastic production using LCA and the planetary boundaries framework. The assessment includes recycling, bio-based and CCU production, and compares their impacts to fossil-based plastics, considering a bottom-up model covering over 90% of global plastic production.
green_innovation: TRUE. The study focuses on GHG mitigation strategies for plastic production, aligning with the concept of green innovation by aiming to reduce negative environmental externalities and promote sustainability.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus of the study is on environmental impact assessment rather than on new product or business process development.
green_product: FALSE. The article discusses GHG mitigation strategies for plastic production but does not specifically focus on the design or development of individual eco-friendly products.
green_process: TRUE. The study evaluates methods in plastic production that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, meeting the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing, 325193 - Ethyl Alcohol Manufacturing, 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on evaluating environmental impacts of GHG mitigation strategies for plastic production using a scientific framework, rather than engaging in deceptive marketing practices.
